p.k: There are a number of countries that given the situation, both geographically and geopolitically serve as an ideological frontier between different civilizations. All of them form a part of Islam. Uzbekistan, Tajikistan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Azerbaijan, Turkmenistan, Afghanistan, which share boarders with Russia, Mongolia and China, the difference in their integration has been shaped by their history, particularly by their recent history, as all of them except Afghanistan once belonged to the now defunct Soviet Union. The later is best known in the west due to the Taliban regime and the confrontations of recent years. The rest are virtually unknown to westerners.
